Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin P
Reviews.Content: The location was great, my family walked to the space needle in 5 minutes. Lots of great restaurants and bars. I wish that there was a pool at the hotel, and a blender in the bar. The rooms were clean and pull outs nice, maid service is kinda so so, but we would stay again at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “forget about the booking request”
Reviews.Author: Iris K
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews tripadvisor, I have put in a request of the room staying away from the construction area when I booked my room. However, when I checked in, I realized my room is right across from the construction area. The manager told me they would only try to accomodate the booking request. After driving for the whole day, I just want to rest well, however the room took me 30 mins wait and finally I got a room away from the construction area. There's a plus for the server in the kitchen. I have bought in some microwavable campbell soup but since there's no microwave in room, I can't reheat it myself. The server helped me to microwave it and gave me some biscuits to eat w my soup. Overall, I don't think I would stay in this hotel again as the rate isn't low ($121+ taxes) but I have to keep on calling to get the room that I have requested in 2 weeks ago. There's no toothbrush, and toothpaste in room that I have to call the operator to bring to me.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing showers and good view”
Reviews.Author: MandaBeck
Reviews.Content: My main memory was that it has the best shower head I've probably ever experienced. Also there was a view of the Space Needle from the balcony of our room. It's a fairly short walk to the Pacific Science Centre and even shorter to the bus stop that we used to go watch a Seattle Seahawks game. From memory the beds were good too but they have probably been changed by now. The breakfast was yummy. A great value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Keep an eye on your possessions, cleaning staff steals !”
Reviews.Author: N J
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed there for one evening in March and were not impressed. The hotel is newly renovated, however the building is quite old. You can hear people walking, talking, running. If you have kids staying above your suite, good luck on getting any sleep. While having breakfast, in the morning, the fire alarm went off, and it was very loud and went off for quite some time, possibly 10 min, we were all looking at each other, thinking what to do, while the staff was walking around casually, there was no direction, evacuation procedure, zero communication. Finally, we asked one of the servers if he knew what was happening, he explained that ‘’they’’ will be here soon to fix it. That was it. After we checked out, my wife realized that she had left her gold bracelet on the night table. We phoned the hotel and returned only to find nothing and that the staff ‘’no e speak English’’. Only the cleaning staff has access to a securely card-lock controlled room. We are told basically too bad, so sad. We wrote letter and called the hotel and head office. The same response, ‘’sorry, could not find it’’ Basically, the gold bracelet walked out of the room on it’s own. Very dissatisfied and unhappy. Very unresponsive management. Will not stay there, nor will we recommend it. We paid $$ to stay at a hotel and get robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: LaidbackTravelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love to visit Seattle on the weekend and enjoy the downtown life. We found this hotel via the Internet and thought we'd give it a try. We were pleasantly surprised. It's right next to the Seattle Space Needle, a short cab ride into the downtown core and Pike Place Market. Clean and spacious rooms and very polite staff. To boot there was free parking on the street. Our only complaint was the roadwork contruction that was happening at the time that woke us up a bit early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: TNLS
Reviews.Content: I used my points to stay in this hotel which is nice, the room is not big but is what you expect for the Four points. Nice and fast wifi connection

Reviews.Title: “Nice property and location, but behind construction site!”
Reviews.Author: Carolinelomeli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a half mile from the space needle and about a mile from downtown which made it a great location for sighseeing. My only complaint about this hotel is that it is literally behind a construction site. If you are an early riser, this should not be a problem for you, but otherwise expect to hear jack hammering around 8 am. I believe that's when the construction noise began. Other than that, this is a great place. The rooms were clean and service was fast and friendly. The beds were super comfortable and there is also a fitness center on the premises. Parking is $12 a night in a secure underground garage which is a lot better than the $35 a night quoted by downtown hotels. Wi-fi is also free so overall this was a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: “lost a lot when sheraton took over”
Reviews.Author: Kathy N
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this establishment. It was much nicer when it was Comfort Inn, the amenities were much better, especially the continental breakfast and we didn't have to pay for parking. This year, we got two towel sets for a two bedroom room, the coffeemaker made one cup of coffee at a time. The beds were full size, not queens, the only improvement that I saw was the huge flat screen TV. There was only one person in the hotel that was helpful and had a smile. The rest of the people there looked like they were miserable. I will look for another place to stay next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, especially on weekends”
Reviews.Author: NWTraveler25
Reviews.Content: Although I was skeptical at first, I was pleasantly surprised with the renovations that Starwood made to the hotel. It used to be a Comfort Suites, but Starwood took over and turned it into a nice Four Points. The hotel is clean and includes all the amenities. Despite it's location next to Highway 99, I was not bothered by the noise. Only thing missing would be free continental breakfast, but the Starwood chain never provides this in any of their hotels. One foot in mouth moment. I am a Platinum member and when I check in, I am supposed to receive an automatic upgrade if available. However, I guess when I made the reservation, it wasn't tied to my SPG #. So when I requested an upgrade, I got this slightly snobbish look and was told that there was availability for an additional $100/night. I asked if Platinum members are automatically upgraded and the front desk agent responded with, "Yes, if you are Platinum..." However, once the front desk agent added my SPG #, this person's jaw dropped and immediately apologized. I found it rather humorous, but was glad they caught the mistake without too much hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: DUTCHRAY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Very convenient located. Near to the space needle and the monorail to down town. Rooms are spacious and clean. Decent price to park your car ($12). Absolutely worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay for a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Ty B
Reviews.Content: I wanted to tell the manager wow that was a noisey toilet, wow that was a noisey heater! My room didn't have light canceling shades! There were towel setups for two guests and we stayed in a two bedroom suite. Having said all of that the room was nice and big. With a little thought it could be a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been rated higher...”
Reviews.Author: Mattiasdad
Reviews.Content: All the previous reviews were spot on. Great location somewhat close to the space needle. Lots of restaurant around. The hotel itself has been recently renovated but there is ongoing construction around the site which makes for some ongoing noise as well as reduced street parking overnight (there is an adjacent lot which charges $5). Would have been a four star rating if not for dirty bed sheets (smelt like dirty diapers) and the noise from the highway when we opened the window to air out the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannyinoa
Reviews.Content: I shared a double room with a friend and we were very pleased with the hotel. The room was nicely set up with modern furniture, the bathroom was also great looking and underground --and cheap-- parking was great because we arrived when it was still snowing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mdb9779
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple days in December on Starwood points. Free stay made it even better. It is a little northeast of downtown, but not too far, near the space needle and museums. The room was better than expected, nice and clean with new furnishings which were pretty modern. The toiletries in the shower were built into a dispinser like pump on the wall. I didn't care for the scent. The elevator was ancient! Didn't match the hotel/room at all. There was plenty of parking on the street. Warning - we went to the little cute coffee place on the corner and couldn't get the smell off our clothes all day. It smelled like rancid grease, obviously no fault of the hotel. These are picky points though. Overall, it was a great stay and nice alternative to the high priced hotels in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Could be closer”
Reviews.Author: thedjlee
Reviews.Content: The Starwood website says, "minutes away from attractions". Hmmm...this hotel is on the outskirts of the downtown. You may be dismayed by the appearance of the locale on arrival. It's not so bad. The area is safe to walk around, and you can see there is the promise of further development. Places to eat are within easy walking distance - use TripAdvisor! The Seattle Center is a longer walk, but if we could do it with our three young children, it's fine. My kids love the Space Needle. To get to the rest of Seattle - bus, monorail, taxi, or tour - are your options. And this is my beef with the Starwood blurb - kinda misleading. If you want a hotel that is truly where it's happening, don't stay here. Positives: Hard-working staff will look after you, if asked. Note, there is no bellhop to take your luggage. We had to get the cart, load it, and wheel it to our room. We don't mind. Value is good - breakfast included with the rate. We could fit our family of five in one room. Free WiFi and water - always welcome! This is a Four Points "thing".

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: sbjr68
Reviews.Content: You won't be disappointed. Close to everything including sights,transportation,bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean, updated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Bridget O
Reviews.Content: We used some of our SPG points to stay here for New Years. We were pleasantly surprised with how convenient the location was in relativity to the Space Needle (walking distance) and downtown (a 3-4 minute ride away on the monorail, which you can catch at the Space Needle). The rooms were very clean and comfortable...overall good bang for your buck. The only reason I gave it a 4 instead of 5 stars is due to the room service we ordered one night. It was pretty bad, but just don't order food and you should be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price not bad either”
Reviews.Author: Liverpool17
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel about five times now. Staff are friendly and seem eager to please. Clean rooms, newly updated. Underground parking for a small fee. 5 min walk from space needle and monorail. If you catch the monorail it will take you to the mall which is about 10min walking distance from Pike Market, downtown and the attractions on the piers including the aquarium. Price is approx $4 round trip for an adult. Great seafood restaurant on Pier 57 called the fisherman's. Awesome seafood, I would recommend the crab feast. 3-4 people can eat for the price of 2, just ask if you can more plates and they will accommodate. Hotel has a small restaurant which has a basic breakfast menu and I think they do a dinner menu too. QFC store right around the corner which has great food to take out if you like baked goods and lazagne, soups, and starbucks coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jane_birkin
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a colleague and I to stay in using Hotwire, so we got it for $60 a night. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. I really appreciated the more modern decor and the use of space in the lobby. it had a more welcoming and less "chain" feeling. My colleague did not find the airy look appealing at all, so you might not either. The quality of the restaurant for breakfast was better than expected. The location was convenient for our ventures to different meetings around the city. I also appreciated the security of the parking lot underneath the building. And, Go to Citizen Coffee 2 blocks away for lunch or a simple dinner! A good thing about Seattle is that you can usually get very good deals on Hotwire if you book around 2 weeks out, but if you try to book a month in advance everything will still be full price.

Reviews.Title: “good value near space needle”
Reviews.Author: valmeras
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Points for 6 nights and was pleased with the experience. The Space Needle and Science Center are 5-10 mins' walk away, while downtown is about 25 min away, but buses are available a block away. It's a great place if you're looking for something cheaper, yet not too far from downtown. Staff and service were friendly and helpful. The newly renovated room was comfy and the bed was very good. The hotel provides free wifi, with public computers/printer downstairs if you don't have your own. There is a supermarket (QFC) just two blocks away and several restaurants within a 5-10 min walk. There is also a coin-operated laundry should you need to clean some clothes. In all, it was a good stay and good value - would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: KaylaRae
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at this hotel and they beds are so comfy!! Slept great for not being in my own bed. Nice rooms, friendly staff, great water pressure in the shower. Only real downside was the complementary coffee sucks! Go to Starbucks at the QFC around the corner or Citizen cafe. Would be nice to have a small fridge, but we just made an ice bin out of the recycling container. All in all good place for the value and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, great complete remodel”
Reviews.Author: TFKinPS
Reviews.Content: In planning a combo biz/vacation in Seattle, this Starwood property showed up in my search...and we're so glad it did. Not one thing wrong with this stay. The fact that the hotel had just been completely remodeled helped...the Four Points brand really is getting it right -- great design, clean look, everything you need without the huge price tag (Starwood points on this trip). Will definitely be sure to look for this brand on other trips. Congrats to the staff and Four Points brand team for creating such a great "refreshed" brand and property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent smaller Hotel”
Reviews.Author: markus555
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was updated this summer (2011) and was very well done! The rooms and bathrooms are well appointed and were very clean, the pillow-top beds were very comfortable and the room very quiet except for the typical walking "thump thump" from the adjoining room. The location is just a few blocks from the Seattle Center grounds "Key- Arena", Space Needle, major theater and Art Museum as well as many restuarants. The "in- house" restuarant was GREAT!!!! excellent food with reasonable prices. There is secure underground parking on-site for $12.00. The staff were all very friendly and helpfull. This is the kind of place you almost want to keep secret, but they deserve the praise!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Four Points Hotel (Really)!”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Diva1
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a long weekend and spend it in Seattle. Over the years I've been skeptical about Four Points because some are not that great and others are just okay. But this location in Seattle near the Space Needle was a pleasant surprise. I don't like surprises when it come to my hotels and this one was fabulous. It just opened two months ago after an extensive renovation and all the rooms are new with very comfortable beds and the bathrooms are spotless. The front desk staff is very friendly and welcoming. I also love the courtyard and the fireplace in the living room area. Very impressive, they have truly set the bar for ALL Four Points properties. Not to mention great rates!! I would definitely stay here again and again. It was a challenge finding it but I'm glad we did, plenty of FREE parking on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: bcoolbaugh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only for one night. It was quiet, clean and worth the time and travel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel Near Space Needle”
Reviews.Author: CATrvl08
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay near the Space Needle and Experience Music Project, this is a nice hotel with good rates. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are really clean having been renovated recently. I would definitely consider staying here agin.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good, Some Negatives”
Reviews.Author: gsuzuki
Reviews.Content: Being a SPG member, I try to stay at Four Points when possible. The last two times I have stayed at a Four Points, the hotel was being renovated. At least this time, the one in Seattle was close to being finished versus the Toronto airport. My wife and I stayed at the Four Points Seattle because on the website it had "free parking". When we checked in, I was informed that there will be a charge for parking. However the person at the front desk said since they are still renovating, the charge might not show up. Also, in order to have a refrigerator in the room, there was also a charge of $10.00 per day. I guess because of the renovation, this charge was also not assessed. The hotel is located about a 10-15 minute walk from the Space Needle/Seattle Center. So getting to downtown Seattle was very convenient because of the monorail. The monorail will take you to about 2 blocks away from Pike's Market. Down the street (across the Hampton Inn) was a QFC super market that is open 24 hours. That made it convenient to buy some snacks and drinks for the room. The size of the room was a little tight for myself and my wife. If there was three adults, it would be very tight. This hotel is using a new type of card to enter your room. Instead of putting the card into the door handle, you place the card flat on a reader right by the door handle and this will unlock the door. During our stay we did not have any problems with this. Overall, our three night stay had no complaints. The only time we were impacted by the renovation was when some of the construction workers was using the elevator so we had to wait for the next one. Just remember that there will be a charge for a refrigerator and parking.

Reviews.Title: “A Noisy Place with Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: allenweiner
Reviews.Content: At the last minute, we decided to change from the Seattle Sheraton downtown to the Four Points because 1) the ad said the rooms had fridges and microwaves and 2) it appeared to be in a better location for getting around. Wrong on both counts. Without going into myriad complaints, it nets out like this: the staff is rude and totally disinterested. It took three calls (and a near threat) to get our room cleaned. The place is noisy as it is located at the intersection of two really busy streets—Highway 99 (Aurora Ave) and Mercer Street (by the Seattle Center). My bad for not looking at the map in a more micro level. The parking garage is ill equipped to handle guest cars if the place is full, so, late Saturday night, we had to squeeze into some illegal, non-parking space. If it’s ambiance you like, there are plenty of cops in the area given the overpopulation of homeless people that line the streets by the Seattle Center. I feel for these folks, but it’s not the sort of scene I look for on a get-away. Again, I suppose my bad for not doing more homework. I guess there’s an app for that. On the plus side, the hotel generously let us stay for a late checkout on Sunday. Also, on the plus side, we stayed here on Starwood Points. The cost was three nights of parking. I did get further clarification as to why I generally stay at Marriott Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel to suit your pocket in Downtown, Seattle”
Reviews.Author: ashok_kelkar
Reviews.Content: For boarding on Cruiz to Alaska, we has selected this Hotel in downtown area as this was found to be reasonably priced. Being in city we could get transport from Hotel to Boeing factory visit. Although a small hotel, but in a quiet area. Rooms were quite satisfactory with morning breakfast available in room rent. Only their renovation work was in progress when we were there and thus could not see other amenities as given on Internet description. However inspite renovation work amenities as shown were provided.viz: Wifi internet in the room,

Reviews.Title: “Decent choice for an alternative Starwood hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Braindrain
Reviews.Content: First off, Seattle/Bellevue is lucky to have so many Starwood hotels. I've been to all of them but this hotel piqued my interest as it offers a more "value" price point. I was recently here for a weekend with my wife. I noticed that this hotel opened up their Cash & Points inventory so had to jump on that as it's an outrageously good deal. As a Starwood Plat member, I was also interested to see what they could offer. The Location As others have mentioned, it's a bit off the main area for downtown. It's a short walk to the monorail station and that can get you back/forth from downtown for cheap. Myself, I drove from downtown to this hotel. A word of warning - research the routes well before you go. Getting on to 5th Ave North was such a pain. Other than that, we really didn't stay around the area much so can't comment on how safe/diverse it is. Lobby/Check-in/Parking When I arrived, the front desk wasn't full. While they did ask me what I wanted for a Plat amenity, I wasn't really explained what other Plat bennies there were even though I explained it was my first time at this hotel. Also, I note that I wasn't put into an upgraded room (other than being on the 4th floor) but I stressed that I wanted a quiet room. More on that later. The lobby area itself is completely remodeled and looks quite contemporary. I did pay for the parking but noted the gate was open when I drove in. I was a bit uncomfortable with the security situation there but noticed the gate was down when I left in the morning. Room The room itself was a king bedroom with a sofabed pull-out. Myself, I thought the size of the room wasn't anything special - long but narrow. Having the sofabed was nice as we had brought dinner with us and sat down on the sofa to eat it together. There's the normal LCD tv and there were quite a few channels. The bathroom was a normal size and noted the sink counter area was a good size. I do also need to comment on how "quiet" it was. I was placed in the inner quadrant with the window facing the roof of a warehouse and then Aurora Ave N. The sound insulation on the windows is so poor that the car noise from Aurora actually came into the room. I've got to say that I'm not right above Aurora. Rather, I'm a good distance from it. A bit disappointing. Perhaps the only other solution is to have a room facing Roy St? Food I did have breakfast in the hotel resto with my wife. Service was prompt and friendly. Food was ok but the cut potatoes were horrid. Coffee was a bit watered-down - which is a surprise given that it's Seattle. Check-out When I checked out, they couldn't give me a printed folio right away as it seemed the front desk didn't know how to handle a Cash & Points booking. No problem, I told them to email it to me after they figured it out. I did receive it later with no problems. I also wanted to mention that the person checking me out noticed that I wasn't given an upgraded room as a Plat. She made it up to us and we were extremely pleased with the outcome. Final verdict Would I come back? Probably. I just have make an accommodation since the hotel isn't right in the downtown core. Would I refer a friend? Probably, also making sure fair warning was given regarding the location. However, the value proposition here is so good that I'm pretty sure I'll return. Problems encountered: 1) There was no in-room RJ45 cable so I called down to have one brought up. Once plugging it in, the wired internet did not work. I just gave and used wireless. However, I prefer wired as it offers a bit better security. 2) One of the bathroom lights "seemed" to be burnt out when I checked-in. As the other was working, I didn't bother calling down to have it replaced. Strangely enough, both lights were working fine the next morning. Very strange.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean and new in Seattle Centre (Space Needle)”
Reviews.Author: carrieryan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Four Points last weekend. It was a lovely new hotel (open since August, I think), with spacious rooms and huge bathrooms. The beds are really comfortable, and the rooms have new flat screen tv's. The staff are really friendly, and eager to help. The restaurant has limited hours but the service is great and the food is good. If you don't need to be right downtown Seattle, or are attending an event at Seattle Centre, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: conventiontraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a remodeled Comfort Inn and it was redone from top to bottom. I stay in many Sheratons when I travel. This is a mini version of the most recent decor scheme found in SPG's new decor and it's contemporary, fresh and well organized. I'm not sure I would recommend this for tourists with children, but for me, I was in walking distance to clients I needed to see on Dexter Avenue. It's a brisk walk downtown and within two blocks is a small retail section under the monorail tracks that has three good restaurants. It took me 10 minutes to walk to my favorite bakery on Wall and 1st. Free internet, great Sheraton beds, quiet and very nice lobby. I would compare this to the new upgraded Marriott Courtyards. The staff was also very helpful; good breakfast/coffee around the corner. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but staff need to improve”
Reviews.Author: TomRatingen
Reviews.Content: This location is freshly renovated, almost completed by end of September 2011. Was a Comfort Inn before. I like the Four Points really, the rooms are big and good equipped (big lcd!) and lot of programs. The bathroom is big and the beds are new and great. Also the gym is perfect for my needs. Parking for $12 in downtown seems ok, allthough you almost always find a space curbside, even with a big pickup truck. -- Just, the staff needs be some improvent to be at "Four Points quality". They seem bored and uninterested if a customers approaches them. Anyway, I definatly judge the room and location much higher, then no good stuff. Definatly a 4* for me, with better staff a 5* for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but gritty surroundings”
Reviews.Author: bshavels
Reviews.Content: Our room at this newly rebranded hotel was comfortable and clean. However, the neighborhood was not attractive. It's near Seattle Center and within walking distance to the monorail, but on the other side of the building is a stretch of trashy industrial spaces. Also, the staff did not seem well-informed and there is little in the way of tourist info at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise, but hard to find”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on points, 2 nights on business. Upgraded to a nice suite, but right next to the highway,good thing I had ear plugs! very pleasant,helpful staff. Don't usually eat hotel food, but not many choices nearby. Breakfast was very good, as was a room service dinner.Great rates for downtown, but you need a car as its off the beaten path. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Benspapa1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights ......three when first in Seattle and one night on the way out after a three day trip to Vancouver. This is a really good hotel and a good deal. Just completely renovated with new beds and new bathrooms, it is clean and in a reasonablly good location. You can walk to the tram (four blocks) to get Downtown to Pikes Place Market. The fare is only two dolloars. There are two very good places to eat just around the corner, Larados, a sophisticated Mexican restaurant, and Citizen, a coffee house, sandwich and breakfast place with very tasty food. The front desk service is happy, customer oriented and pleasant. Parking is an issue if you want to avoid the $12 a day fee from the hotel but with a little patience you can find a spot on the street. Note that the parking facists are very active and you need to be sure you are in a good spot. I was very pleased with the experience. The hotel is very close to the lakes and I recommend the seaplane tour- not too expensive and very informative. You can book this hotel with no worries.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JenniferK30
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past weekend with a friend - we were in Seattle to go to the Mariners game. The hotel looks like they are still finishing renovations, but that did not affect our stay at all. The room was clean and quiet and the bed was very comfortable. It's not exactly walking distance to the downtown shopping or Pike Place market area. But, it was only a short cab ride away. Also, the hotel had a shuttle come by and pick up guests who were going to the ball game, for a fee of $5 per person. It was very reasonable and so we took the shuttle. Seattle is a great city, and this hotel was more affordable than most of the hotels in the downtown core. The only downside is its location, since it is not quite as central. But, overall it was a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: tomj675
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 1 night just before boarding our cruise ship to Alaska. Lots of people must do this because almost everyone there was either just starting or just finishing a cruise. They had just opened after going through a renovation and changing from a (I think) Comfort Inn. We used SPG points for the night and this got us excellent treatment from the front desk, even though the staff was new to SPG. The gave us a coupon for free breakfast which was delicious, cooked to order with all the fixings.....not your typical "hot buffet" in which the only thing hot is the "make it yourself" waffles. The room/bed was brand new and although small, very comfy. The beds of course were brand new and the AC worked great. The elevator was a bit slow since only one in the remodeled section was working. We ended up finding a different one in the old section, however and it worked out fine. Check-in and check-out, including the shuttle to the ship went very smoothly. I would highly recommend this hotel for a pre or post cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Changes have been made...To Make More Money, not to improve the guest's experience”
Reviews.Author: jpete02
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel while it was still a Comfort Suites and were notified about three weeks before our stay it would be changing to a Sheraton Four Points. I wasn't too thrilled because I have generally been pleased with Comfort Suites' hotels and underwhelmed with the Sheraton Four Points chain. To their credit, they honored our rate and free parking but we probaby wouldn't stay here again. The changes that have been made were not for the better. The rooms seem to have been shrunk from a much larger Comfort Suite size to a typical hotel room. The parking is no longer free (unless you booked when it was a Comfort Suites) and you no longer get a free breakfast either. The rooms have been remodeled with more modern styling but not everything works quite right, especially in the bathroom. The clear glass shower door is hard to open from the inside as there is no handle on the interior part of the door. In addition, the shower door didn't open all they way out. The toilet paper roll also kept falling off the modern looking toliet paper holder. We had a SUV (Chevy Traverse) and were able to get the car in the garage with no problem. The garage has a gate that can only be opened with a valid hotel key, so it felt very secure. The parking in the garage below the hotel is tight but we were able to get a spot when the hotel was full because of the Labor Day Holiday. Location of the hotel is fairly good. The area is very nice and you are within walking distance of the Space Needle and monorail station. The monorail will take you to within 3 blocks of Pike Place Market or you can take a taxi. You will probably have to pick up the taxi at the Space Needle because the Four Points is off on a side street. Some rooms do have views of the Space Needle but they also face a busy, high speed road below, which can be quite noisy. Guess putting in double pane windows wasn't part of the renovations but double pane windows don't generate any extra revenue either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: kalenacole
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to stores, restaurants, clubs etc. I really love the beds at Sheraton hotels. They are comfortable and feel like you're enveloped in feathers. However, upon checking in, the hotel took an almost $400 deposit on my credit card for incidentals...huh?!! Refundable or not, that is crazy for a 3 day stay, thank goodness I didn't need my credit card for anything else. I also don't like like the fact the hotel charges $10.95 a 24hr period for internet use in your room. There is free internet in the lobby, so if you don't mind sitting around with about 20 or 30 strangers trying to get the almost non-existent signal (took me over 30 mins), then go right ahead, otherwise prepare to fork over your $10.95. Actually for the rate, internet should be included. Overall, I like the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Now 4Points Sheraton and still under renovation, but promising”
Reviews.Author: mzungu f
Reviews.Content: Good price for Downtown, and close to the Space needle, however under renovation and due to the original structure if you get a room under/over the room still under construction you will be sorry if they cannot move you to another side of hotel due to vibration and noise. I was lucky and they moved me - the new rooms are clean, with new linens, bathrooms, TVs, A/C. Decor is very pleasant and modern, and there is a nice lobby area with computers and flat screen TVs and a Bar. Not walkable to the heart of Seattle Shopping and Restaurants, but a $7 cab ride will get you there. Garage height requirement too low for standard SUVs so beware if you need parking and factor that into the price. Only one slow elevator, which made it difficult with luggage to compete with other travelors. checkout line was so long i could not wait, but hopefully management will address the need for additional staff - or provide express checkout or put the receipt under the door at nite. The staff was very competent and accommodating, and service was excellent. They are going the xtra mile to make the best of a hotel in transition.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - construction never mentioned when I booked - hotel a mess!”
Reviews.Author: brunelloafcionado
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. I had pre-booked months in advance because we were attending a graduation at the University. I booked directly from their web site because I wanted a larger suite and did not feel comfortable doing that through one of the on-line discounters. The hotel was under going serious renovation (not noted when I booked). Hotel specified a free breakfast daily - what we got was a bag of junk. When we got there, the 90 year old that was with us would have liked to take a quick nap but couldn't due to the loud sawing noises coming through the walls. Carpets were ripped up in places and the whole floors were in a disarray. Why they put us so close to the construction is beyond me. Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back until the renovations are finished”
Reviews.Author: Greg8122
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Comfort Inn Suites. Our understanding is that it has been purchased by Sheraton and is going thru a major renovation. The rooms are large, beds are great and the location is a bit industrial but close to the Needle, museum etc. The first issues we had was the tv remote was not working and that was never resolved. The second issue was the so called breakfast included was apples, oranges, juice and coffee on a table in the hallway on the second floor (totally unacceptable!) Probably will be an OK hotel after the renovations but make sure to call and inquire first.

HotelInfo.Name: Four Points by Sheraton Downtown Seattle Center
HotelInfo.Address: 601 Roy Street, Seattle, WA 98109-3160
